Semilinear Problem classesÔÉÅ

class rb_semilinear.sl_problems.Fisher(N_h: int, solver: MyNewtonSolver, initGuess_strategy: Literal['P', '0.5', '0', 'LP', None])ÔÉÅ

Elliptic Fisher‚Äôs equation.

This class implements the steady-state version of the Fisher equation:

-div(mu * ‚àáu) - u(1 - u) = 0

It is solved using the provided solver and the initGuess_strategy.

Parameters:

  • N_h (int) ‚Äì Number of mesh intervals for spatial discretization.

  • solver (NewtonSolver or PETScSNESSolver) ‚Äì Solver object used to solve the PDE.

  • initGuess_strategy ({"P", "0.5", "0", "LP", None}) ‚Äì

    Strategy to initialize self.u.

    Options:

    • ‚ÄùP‚Äù: Use soluion of the Poisson equation -div(D‚àáu) = f

    • ‚Äù0.5‚Äù: Sets u = 0.5 (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚Äù0‚Äù: Sets u = 0.0 (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚ÄùLP‚Äù: Use solution of a linearized version of the semilinear problem -div(D‚àáu) - u = f

    • None: Uses the current value of self.u.

class rb_semilinear.sl_problems.Fisher_mms(N_h: int, solver: MyNewtonSolver, initGuess_strategy: Literal['P', '0.5', '0', 'LP', None])ÔÉÅ

Elliptic Fisher‚Äôs equation with a manufactured exact solution.

This class implements the steady-state version of the Fisher equation:

-div(D * ‚àáu) - u(1 - u) = f,

The exact solution is:

u_ex(x) = a * sin(2œÄ * b * x),

The source term ‚Äòf‚Äô is derived using symbolic differentiation with SymPy.

It is solved using ‚Äòsolver‚Äô with ‚ÄòinitGuess_strategy‚Äô.

Parameters:

  • N_h (int) ‚Äì Number of mesh intervals for spatial discretization

  • solver (NewtonSolver or PETScSNESSolver) ‚Äì Solver object used to solve the PDE

  • strategy ({"P", "0.5", "0", "LP", None}) ‚Äì

    Strategy to initialize self.u.

    Options:

    • ‚ÄùP‚Äù: Use soluion of the Poisson equation -div(D‚àáu) = f

    • ‚Äù0.5‚Äù: Sets u = 0.5 (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚Äù0‚Äù: Sets u = 0.0 (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚ÄùLP‚Äù: Use solution of a linearized version of the semilinear problem

      -div(D‚àáu) - u = f

    • None: Uses the current value of self.u.

errornorms()ÔÉÅ

Computes error norms between the computed solution ‚Äòself.u‚Äô and the exact solution ‚Äòself.u_D‚Äô.

Returns:

  • dict

  • A dictionary with error norms

  • - ||u-u_e||_L2 (L2 norm)

  • - ||u_dofs-u_e_dofs||_inf (Maximum norm)

  • - |u-u_e|_H10 (H1 seminorm)

solve(mu: float)ÔÉÅ

Solve semilinear PDE for parameter value ‚Äòmu‚Äô with initial guess strategy ‚Äòself.initGuess_stratey‚Äô using ‚Äòself.solver‚Äô.

Parameters:

mu (float) ‚Äì paramter value

Returns:

  • solInfo (dict) ‚Äì information about solution

  • NitInfos (dict) ‚Äì information about Newton iterations

Note

The initial guess strategy is specified in ‚Äòself.initGuess_strategy‚Äô when instantiating a ‚ÄòMySemilinearProblem‚Äô object. It can be changed by modifying ‚Äòself.initGuess_strategy‚Äô.

class rb_semilinear.sl_problems.MySemilinearProblem(N_h: int, q: Callable[[Any], Any], f: Expression, u_D: Expression, solver: MyNewtonSolver, initGuess_strategy: Literal['0', '0.5', 'P', 'LP', None])ÔÉÅ

Base class for semilinear elliptic PDEs in one dimension

Setup for general semilinear elliptic PDE:

-div(mu * ‚àáu) - q(u) = f in Œ© = (0, 1), u = u_D on ‚àÇŒ©.

The problem is discretized using linear Lagrange elemens.

It is solved using ‚Äòsolver‚Äô with ‚ÄòinitGuess_strategy‚Äô.

Parameters:

  • N_h (int) ‚Äì The number of discretization intervalls

  • q (function) ‚Äì The nonlinear reaction term

  • f (Expression) ‚Äì The force term

  • u_D (Expression) ‚Äì The Dirichlet Function

  • solver (MyNewtonSolver) ‚Äì A Newton Solver

  • strategy ({"P", "0.5", "0", "LP", None} - specifies how to initialize 'self.u'.) ‚Äì

    Options:

    • ‚ÄùP‚Äù: Solves the Poisson equation (-div(D‚àáu) = f)

      and uses the result as initial guess.

    • ‚Äù0.5‚Äù: Sets ‚Äòu = 0.5‚Äô (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚Äù0‚Äù: Sets ‚Äòu = 0.0‚Äô (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚ÄùLP‚Äù: Solves a linearized version of the semilinear problem:

      -div(D‚àáu) - u = f and uses the result as initial guess.

    • None: Uses the current value of ‚Äòself.u‚Äô

F(b, x)ÔÉÅ

Assemble Residual vector of semilinear PDE at state ‚Äòx‚Äô. update ‚Äòself.resNorm‚Äô and apply Dirichlet boundary condtions ‚Äòself.bcs‚Äô

Parameters:

  • b (PETScVector) ‚Äì Vector object where Residual vector will be stored

  • x (PETScVector) ‚Äì Vector of degrees of freedom of the state at which the Residual is evaluated

J(A, x)ÔÉÅ

Assemble Jacobian matrix of semilinear PDE at state ‚Äòx‚Äô. and apply Dirichlet boundary conditions ‚Äòself.bcs‚Äô

Parameters:

  • A (PETScMatrix) ‚Äì Matrix object where Jacobian matrix will be stored

  • x (PETScVector) ‚Äì Vector of degrees of freedom of the state, at which the Jacobian is evaluated

set_initGuess(strategy: Literal['P', '0.5', '0', 'LP', None])ÔÉÅ

Set initial guess for the nonlinear solver based on a chosen strategy.

This method modifies ‚Äòself.u‚Äô to provide an initial guess before solving a nonlinear problem.

Parameters:

strategy ({"P", "0.5", "0", "LP", None}) ‚Äì

Strategy to initialize self.u.

Options:

  • ‚ÄùP‚Äù: Use soluion of the Poisson equation -div(D‚àáu) = f

  • ‚Äù0.5‚Äù: Sets u = 0.5 (with boundary conditions).

  • ‚Äù0‚Äù: Sets u = 0.0 (with boundary conditions).

  • ‚ÄùLP‚Äù: Use solution of a linearized version of the semilinear problem

    -div(D‚àáu) - u = f

  • None: Uses the current value of self.u.

set_mu(mu: float)ÔÉÅ

Set parameter value of problem ‚Äòself.mu‚Äô to value ‚Äòmu‚Äô

Parameters:

mu (float) ‚Äì parameter value

set_solver(solver)ÔÉÅ

Set Newton-type solver for solving the semilinear PDE

Parameters:

solver (MyNewton)

solve(mu: float)ÔÉÅ

Solve semilinear PDE for parameter value ‚Äòmu‚Äô with initial guess strategy ‚Äòself.initGuess_stratey‚Äô using ‚Äòself.solver‚Äô.

Parameters:

mu (float) ‚Äì paramter value

Returns:

  • solInfo (dict) ‚Äì information about solution

  • NitInfos (dict) ‚Äì information about Newton iterations

Note

The initial guess strategy is specified in ‚Äòself.initGuess_strategy‚Äô when instantiating a ‚ÄòMySemilinearProblem‚Äô object. It can be changed by modifying ‚Äòself.initGuess_strategy‚Äô.

class rb_semilinear.sl_problems.Poisson(N_h: int, solver: MyNewtonSolver)ÔÉÅ

linear Poisson problem (special case of semilinear PDE)

It is solved using ‚Äòsolver‚Äô.

Parameters:

  • N_h (int) ‚Äì Number of mesh intervals for spatial discretization

  • solver (: MyNewtonSolver) ‚Äì Solver object used to solve the PDE

class rb_semilinear.sl_problems.SemilinearPoisson(N_h: int, solver: MyNewtonSolver, initGuess_strategy: Literal['P', '0.5', '0', 'LP', None])ÔÉÅ

Semilinear Poisson equation with cubic nonlinearity

This class implements a semilinear elliptic PDE:

-div(D ‚àáu) + u¬≥ = 0

It is solved using ‚Äòsolver‚Äô with ‚ÄòinitGuess_strategy‚Äô.

Parameters:

  • N_h (int) ‚Äì Number of mesh intervals for spatial discretization

  • solver (: MyNewtonSolver) ‚Äì Solver object used to solve the PDE

  • initGuess_strategy ({"P", "0.5", "0", "LP", None}) ‚Äì

    Strategy to initialize self.u.

    Options:

    • ‚ÄùP‚Äù: Use soluion of the Poisson equation -div(D‚àáu) = f

    • ‚Äù0.5‚Äù: Sets u = 0.5 (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚Äù0‚Äù: Sets u = 0.0 (with boundary conditions).

    • ‚ÄùLP‚Äù: Use solution of a linearized version of the semilinear problem -div(D‚àáu) - u = f

    • None: Uses the current value of self.u.
